subject: Add support for AppendLimit and ReportUpdates
commitMessage:
Add support for AppendLimit and ReportUpdates

Added 2 new properties for Report interface: AppendLimit and
ReportUpdates. They were also added as arguments to the future version
of AddReport method of ReportManager.

ReportUpdates property defines the report update behavior:
- Overwrite: Each report update overrides previous "Readings" property.
  "AppendLimit" set by user is not respected - "Readings" property size
  is equal to count of all sensor across all metrics defined in report.
- AppendWrapsWhenFull: New readings are appended until limit specified
  by "AppendLimit" is reached. Then oldest readings are overwritten by
  new ones.
- AppendStopsWhenFull: New readings are appended until limit specified
  by "AppendLimit" is reached. Then updates are stopped.
- NewReport: not supported yet and will be implemented in the future.

Please note that if ReportingType is set to OnRequest, those 2 new
properties are ignored, and Readings property will contain one reading
per defined sensor, across all metrics. They are still stored, which
means that if ReportingType will be changed in the runtime, those
properties will be respected.

Tested:
- Both new properties can be accessed from dbus.
- Both properties are reflected in Readings property.
- Old AddReport method is working as before the change.
- UTs are passing.

Signed-off-by: Szymon Dompke <szymon.dompke@intel.com>
Change-Id: I8a18f7e68215f0f6e5c403b533d2c4ff479df69e

clear/resize doesn't change size of internal storage (capacity stays the same) so reserve is not needed after clear. If you get rid of this if you can remove member variable reserve. There will be only one reserve in constructor.

If you wish to delete allocated memory shrink_to_fit needs to be called.
Done

This may have significant impact on binary size, if we want to use it we must verify how it affects binary size.

To keep it simple I would restore it to previous version.

With this modification: 26,248,704 bytes
Without this modification: 26,192,240 bytes

You are right, this verbosity is not required on release binary, although it helped me few times during development 😊
Maybe ternary operator can be a good alternative here? By using it you can put all this code in single line only.

It doesn't matter. If you inline it you will loose meaningful name ('deduceReportUpdates'). Whatever you put if here or ternary operator doesn't change much.

In my opinion it's better to have meaningful name. Anyway it's a minor thing that should not have much impact on readability.
I deleted this function - the functionality is not needed.
nit: deduce word seems not to be best naming match in this context, maybe you could change it for 'obtain', 'fetch' or simply 'get'?
Obtain, fetch, get assume that it's already determined. Deduce means that implementation calculates proper bufferSize.
I agree with Krzysztof, as that was exactly my intention here.

I would vote for reversing order of if conditions, so:

  if (reportingTypeIn == ReportingType::OnRequest ||
        reportUpdatesIn == ReportUpdates::Overwrite)
    return sensorCount;
  else ...
Done
Should this be 'auto' if you explicitly specified return value as 'std::string()'?

Actually It would be nice if we followed follower rule to almost always use auto.

Do in this case we should change std::string newVal to auto newVal.
Also to properly send signal we should change oldVal, sdbusplus is using oldValue as a reference to determine whatever value changed.

https://github.com/openbmc/sdbusplus/blob/b466765473ac442b8f482b0a8f4356b330437bcc/include/sdbusplus/asio/object_server.hpp:319

Lukasz - As far as I understand, the second parameter of register_property_rw is only used to deduce the type, not value - for value the getter is called. So to not call the conversion twice I passed an empty string.

Krzysztof - I changed std::string newVal to auto newVal. What did you mean by 'almost always'? Are there any use cases when it wouldn't work?
Ack
It should not matter for override. We should ensure that if it's override it has correct maxSize
